page.title: 11TRADE IN THURNSCOE
page.content: Trade in Thurnscoe is mainly shops and the market in the East end. The{market sells fruit, electrical appliances, fish, wool, cards and clothes. There are many{small shops}in Thurnscoe. There are many butchers, bakers and small supermarkets in Thurnscoe such as Liptons and the Co-op where they have a system where you go round and get the things you want. In some shops like Hilarys and Lorne Road Stores, you have to to to the counter and ask for the things you want. In many shops you help yourself but in others you ask over the counter. There are three chip shops in Thurnscoe, Ivors, Lorne Road and Lloyds. In Thurnscoe there are no Hypermarkets. There is one petrol station and a small bank and building society. There aren't any big electrical shops or car showrooms so people have to go to the larger towns.
